text: Tamio "Tommy" Kono (June 27, 1930 â€“ April 24, 2016) was an American weightlifter in the 1950s and 1960s. Kono was the only Olympic weightlifter in history to have set world records in four different weight classes: lightweight (149 pounds or 67.5 kilograms), middleweight (165 lb or 75 kg), light-heavyweight (182 lb or 82.5 kg), and middle-heavyweight (198 lb or 90 kg). In 1993 Kono was elected to the International Weightlifting Federation Hall of Fame. Kono was also an inductee to the Association of Oldetime Barbell and Strongmen (A.O.B.S.) Hall of Fame. Kono died on April 24, 2016 in Honolulu, Hawaii from complications of liver disease, aged 85.Olympic weightlifter Kono dies at 85 ==References== ==Other websites== * Tommy Kono, Hall of Fame at Lift Up * Category:1930 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American weightlifters Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Deaths from liver disease Category:Medalists at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Sacramento, California Category:Sportsmen
title: Tommy Kono
